problem_statement: Implement an iterative Breadth-First Search (BFS) maze solver that finds the shortest path between two coordinates in a 2D grid maze containing walkable cells (0) and walls (1). Your solution must use a queue for exploration, track parent nodes for path reconstruction, and handle mazes up to 50,000Ã—50,000 cells efficiently without recursion. Return both the coordinate list of the shortest path and its length, or an empty path if no solution exists.
